alert.note: Alert for Knox (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 15 at 3:51PM CDT until July 15 at 7:45PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM EDT FOR EAST CENTRAL KNOX...WEST CENTRAL JEFFERSON AND NORTHWESTERN SEVIER COUNTIES... At 451 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 8 miles west of Sevierville, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Sevierville, Pigeon Forge, McMahan, Harrisburg, Seymour, Kodak and Kimberlin Heights. This includes Interstate 40 in Tennessee between mile markers 402 and 410. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
